General.text:
Type: Beta agonist;
Antiarrhythmics
Dosage Forms: IV or IM injection
Common Trade Names: Isoprenaline, Isuprel

Adult_Dosing.text:
Loading dose: 0.02-0.06 mg IV, followed by infusion
[1]
[2]
2-20 mcg/min IV infusion
Titrate to HR and BP
Alternatively, bolus 0.02-0.06 mg IV, then 0.01-0.2 mg IV PRN

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
No well controlled studies for appropriate dosing
AHA recommends initial infusion of 0.1 mcg/kg/min, with titrated range usually 0.1-1 mcg/kg/min
[3]

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Unknown
Renal Dosing - undefined
Hepatic Dosing - undefined

Indications.text:
Refractory
torsades
Refractory symptomatic
bradycardia
Refractory
electrical storm
Brugada syndrome

Adverse_Reactions.text:
Dramatic increase in O2 demand
V-tach (use lowest dose possible)

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2-10 min
[4]
Metabolism: liver, CYP450
Excretion: urine primarily
Mechanism of Action: Beta adrenergic agonist

Kinetics.text:
Onset of action = 1-5 min
Duration of action = 1-2 hr
